On this page:

  • Load packages

Data manipulation

Author

Marie-Hélène Burle

Once we know what is in our data, we can start playing with it. Let’s manipulate the us_contagious_diseases dataset from the dslabs package.

Load packages

library(dslabs)
library(dplyr)

Attaching package: 'dplyr'
The following objects are masked from 'package:stats':

    filter, lag
The following objects are masked from 'package:base':

    intersect, setdiff, setequal, union

Selecting data

us_contagious_diseases |>
  filter(state == "California")

  filter(state == "California" & year > 2000 & disease == "Hepatitis A") |>
  select(year, count, population)
